unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Meaning of a Confidence Level for Proportions: Town Budget
question_text: A random sample of $100$ citizens in a town were asked: "Would you approve the budget proposal?". A $90\%$ confidence interval was constructed for the proportion of citizens who would approve the budget and yielded a result of $(0.567, 0.634)$ . Which of the following statements is correct?

choices.text: About 90 % 90 % of all random samples of 100 100 citizens from this town would result in a 90 % 90 % confidence interval of ( 0.567 , 0.634 ) ( 0.567 , 0.634 ) .
90 % 90 % of citizens in the survey reported that they had a 56.7 % 56.7 % to 63.4 % 63.4 % chance of approving the budget.
90 % 90 % of all possible samples of 100 100 citizens will contain the interval ( 0.567 , 0.634 ) ( 0.567 , 0.634 ) .
About 90 % 90 % of all random samples of 100 100 citizens from the town would result in a confidence interval that captures the population proportion of citizens who approve the budget.
90 % 90 % of the time the interval from ( 0.567 , 0.634 ) ( 0.567 , 0.634 ) will contain the population proportion of citizens who would approve the budget.
